section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 1. Chapter 1: Certain Infectious and Parasitic Diseases > d. Sepsis, Severe Sepsis, and Septic Shock > 1. Coding of Sepsis and Severe Sepsis > b. Severe sepsis

content.full_text: The coding of severe sepsis requires a minimum of 2 codes: first a code for the underlying systemic infection, followed by a code from subcategory R65.2, Severe sepsis. If the causal organism is not documented, assign code A41.9, Sepsis, unspecified organism, for the infection. Additional code(s) for the associated acute organ dysfunction are also required. Due to the complex nature of severe sepsis, some cases may require querying the provider prior to assignment of the codes. (Evidence: pg no: 24, L77-L79)

detailed_rules.rule_text: The coding of severe sepsis requires a minimum of 2 codes: first a code for the underlying systemic infection, followed by a code from subcategory R65.2, Severe sepsis (Evidence: pg no: 24, L77-L78)
detailed_rules.explanation: Severe sepsis always requires at least two codes in specific sequence: infection code first, then R65.2 code (Evidence: pg no: 24, L77-L78)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If the causal organism is not documented, assign code A41.9, Sepsis, unspecified organism, for the infection (Evidence: pg no: 24, L78-L79)
detailed_rules.explanation: When organism is unknown in severe sepsis, use A41.9 as the first code before R65.2 (Evidence: pg no: 24, L78-L79)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Additional code(s) for the associated acute organ dysfunction are also required (Evidence: pg no: 24, L79)
detailed_rules.explanation: Beyond the minimum two codes, additional codes must be assigned for each acute organ dysfunction present (Evidence: pg no: 24, L79)
